front.title: Generic Fault-avoidance Routing Protocol for Data Center Networks

abstract.t: This draft proposed a generic routing method and protocol for a regular data center network, named as the fault-avoidance routing (FAR) protocol. FAR protocol provides a generic routing method for all kinds of network architectures that are proposed for large-scale cloud data centers over the past few years. FAR protocol is well designed to fully leverage the regularity in the topology and compute its routing table in a simple way. Fat-tree is taken as an example architecture to illuminate how to apply FAR protocol in this draft.
